conbody.p: functionsmath functionsmath functionsdescriptionUse math functions to perform math on numeric values. You can replace any argument with a constant, or a field or expression that evaluates to a number.

You can use the following data types with math functions:
Double
Float
Integer
Long
String parses a string as a Double value if the numeric value in a String field contains a dot ( . ). Otherwise, parses the string as a Long value.

The expression language provides the following math functions:
math:abs(<number>) Returns the absolute value, or positive version, of the argument. If the argument is already positive, returns the original number. Return type: Double, Float, Int, or Long, based on the data type of the argument.
math:ceil(<number>) Returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to the argument. Return type: Double.
math:floor (<number>) Returns the largest integer greater than or equal to the argument. Return type: Double.
math:max(<number1>, <number2>) Returns the greater of two arguments. Return type: Double, Float, Int, or Long, based on the data type of the argument.
math:min(<number1>, <number2>) Returns the lesser of two arguments. Return type: Double, Float, Int, or Long, based on the data type of the argument.
math:round(<number>) Returns the closest integer to the argument, rounding up for ties. Return type: Double or Long.
